IlluminatedWorldsRoller.RollFailureDescr: You donâ€™t accomplish what you wanted, and there are consequences.
IlluminatedWorldsRoller.RollMixedSuccess: You accomplish what you wanted, but it comes at a cost.
IlluminatedWorldsRoller.RollSuccessDescr: You get what you want without any major unintended consequences.
IlluminatedWorldsRoller.RollCriticalSucc: You get what you want, and something extra.
IlluminatedWorldsRoller.RollZeroMode: Zero Dice rolled - rolling two dice and taking the lowest
IlluminatedWorldsRoller.RollHighStakesDe: Because this roll is high stakes, failure will likely result in taking damage or finding yourself in a very difficult position.
IlluminatedWorldsRoller.RollLowStakesDes: Because this roll is low stakes, failure won't likely put you in immediate peril.
IlluminatedWorldsRoller.ActionsHint: A comma separated list of the actions used by your system
IlluminatedWorldsRoller.MaxStandardDiceC: The maximum number of standard dice available in the popup
IlluminatedWorldsRoller.DefaultStandardD: The number of standard dice that will start selected in the popup
IlluminatedWorldsRoller.DefaultStakesHin: The default stakes that will start selected in the popup
IlluminatedWorldsRoller.BackgroundColorH: The background color of the dice results in the chat messages
IlluminatedWorldsRoller.GildedAppearance: For Dice So Nice! users, the theme to use for gilded dice
IlluminatedWorldsRoller.GildedIsBestResu: (And because the best result is from a gilded die, make sure to reclaim one drive point.)
IlluminatedWorldsRoller.GildedIsOnlyResu: (And because you used a result rolled on a gilded die, make sure to reclaim one drive point.)
IlluminatedWorldsRoller.GildedIsSameResu: (The result from the dice pool and your gilded result are the same. You should reclaim one drive point.)
IlluminatedWorldsRoller.GildedMixedIsWor: (Or you can opt to take a Mixed Success from the gilded die and reclaim one drive point.)
IlluminatedWorldsRoller.GildedFailureIsW: (Or you can opt to take a Failure from the gilded die and reclaim one drive point.)
